body:
Looking at [FindVorbis.cmake](https://github.com/SFML/SFML/blob/master/cmake/Modules/FindVorbis.cmake#L25), the uppercase CMake package `VORBIS` is searched, and variables referring to it also use upper case:

    find_package_handle_standard_args(VORBIS DEFAULT_MSG VORBIS_LIBRARIES VORBIS_INCLUDE_DIR OGG_INCLUDE_DIR)
    set(VORBIS_INCLUDE_DIRS ${OGG_INCLUDE_DIR} ${VORBIS_INCLUDE_DIR})

The Vorbis package is found at [this line in the Audio config](https://github.com/SFML/SFML/blob/master/src/SFML/Audio/CMakeLists.txt#L70):

    sfml_find_package(Vorbis INCLUDE "VORBIS_INCLUDE_DIRS" LINK "VORBIS_LIBRARIES")

But here we use the uppercase variables as exported in `FindVorbis.cmake`. If we changed the line to `sfml_find_package(VORBIS...`, then the filename `FindVorbis.cmake` would not match anymore.

Where exactly is the conflict?

The conflict is between `sfml_find_package(Vorbis REQUIRED)` and `find_package_handle_standard_args(VORBIS ...`
Because `find_package_handle_standard_args` will search in `VORBIS_FIND_REQUIRED` instead of `Vorbis_FIND_REQUIRED` variable set by `find_package(${target} REQUIRED)` in `sfml_find_package` where target is `Vorbis`

It's also a bad practice to have variable that are not in the format <PACKAGE_NAME>_* however due to the difference in case none of the variable create in FindVorbis match with Vorbis package name as it is not fully in uppercase

issue.title: Rename FindVorbis -> FindVORBIS, for consistency with exported variab‚Ä¶

body:
Thanks for the elaboration. I was looking at other find modules which are not all-uppercase (`FindFreetype.cmake`, `FindUDev.cmake`), and the problem doesn't exist there, because the `FREETYPE_FOUND`/`UDEV_FOUND` is set manually and not through a call to `find_package_handle_standard_args()`.

I added a pull request, could you check if that branch works for you?

Seems to work I correctly get üëç 
```
CMake Error at /usr/share/cmake-3.10/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:137 (message):
  Could NOT find VORBIS (missing: VORBIS_INCLUDE_DIR)
```

issue.title: Pull request for 2.6.x CSFML

repository.name: CSFML
repository.description: Official binding of SFML for C

issue.body:
This PR will be for getting all of the 2.6.x features into CSFML. Here is a test project that I have an open source to test the project with. Currently, I have font enabled and disabled by pressing the s key https://github.com/dogunbound/CSFML_2.6_sample 

I hope we can hack this out. 2.6.x is pretty stable, so I think it would be good to begin working on this.

Basically, we need to slowly go through EVERY pull request and see if any change needs to be made and make those changes. If there aren't any changes needed for a specific pull request, mark it as complete.

issue.title: Implement remaining SFML 2.6.0 changes

repository.name: CSFML
repository.description: Official binding of SFML for C

issue.body:
Credit to @dogunbound for this list from PR #186. I'm moving this list out to its own issue so we can track these changes while we incrementally merge PRs.

---

Basically, we need to slowly go through EVERY pull request and see if any change needs to be made and make those changes. If there aren't any changes needed for a specific pull request, mark it as complete.

body:
A potential error that one might face for future reference:

Description:    Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS
Release:        22.04


Error I encountered while using the **cmake-sfml-project template**

`$ cmake .`
-- libudev stable: 1
-- Found UDev: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libudev.so
--    include: /usr/include
CMake Error at /snap/cmake/1463/share/cmake-4.0/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:227 (message):
  Could NOT find Vorbis (missing: VORBIS_INCLUDE_DIR VORBIS_LIBRARY)
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /snap/cmake/1463/share/cmake-4.0/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:591 (_FPHSA_FAILURE_MESSAGE)
  _deps/sfml-src/cmake/Modules/FindVorbis.cmake:20 (find_package_handle_standard_args)
  _deps/sfml-src/src/SFML/Audio/CMakeLists.txt:72 (find_package)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!


Solved by: `$ sudo apt install libvorbis-dev`
@AndrewMbugua the instructions for that template already tell you to do that.
